title: In a relief to booksellers, Centre to align Book Post tariff with earlier subsidised Book Packet rates
content: With the new Post Office Act, 2023, coming into effect, Book Packet, the much preferred service to send books by publishers and small magazines was scrapped, and instead booksellers had to opt for the Book Post service, which was costlier

title: What is Elon Musk’s Starlink all about? | Explained
content: What is Starlink, and how does it work? Why does it face regulatory hurdles in India? Why hasn’t India auctioned satellite spectrum? What impact could U.S. trade pressure have on Starlink’s approval? What government approvals does Starlink need?

title: Amid global uncertainties, spy chiefs from across world converge in Delhi
content: Counterterrorism, Intelligence-sharing mechanisms and extradition were among a host of issues discussed at the conference, which is held a day before the Raisina Dialogue

title: BJP turning India into ‘a Hindu Pakistan’, Sanjay Raut says in Saamana
content: ‘This country survived because people like Pandit Nehru did not allow it to become a Hindu Pakistan, but during the Modi era, the country is being pushed towards a new Partition,’ Sanjay Raut wrote in an editorial in the Shiv Sena (UBT) mouthpiece

title: A school that made childhood an experience to cherish
content: PS Higher Secondary School alumni say teachers did not put pressure on them to study to become achievers

title: 262 villages in Kalaburagi district may face water scarcity during summer
content: A comprehensive plan has been prepared to tackle drinking water shortage by reviving dried borewells and piped supply

title: Bengal BJP begins search for new State president
content: On Friday, the State unit of the BJP released a list of 25 organisational district presidents. There are 17 new faces with several MLAs having been removed from the post of district president

title: Congress targets govt. over air quality report ranking India as fifth most polluted country
content: Jairam Ramesh seeks roll back of ‘anti-people’ environment law amendments over past 10 years; he asks Centre to revamp norms, increase funds

title: Sikh radical MP Amritpal’s aides to face trial in Punjab
content: The seven key aides of the jailed MP are lodged in the Dibrugarh jail in Assam under the National Security Act

title: 11 arrested in M.P. over ‘murder’ of police officer; CM announces ₹1 crore ex gratia for ASI’s kin
content: It is alleged that the Assistant Sub-Inspector was attacked by tribals, who had allegedly abducted a man, while a police team went to rescue him. State Congress chief says the tribals retaliated as the police committed atrocities on them.

title: False narrative created over 2002 Gujarat riots, courts found us innocent: PM
content: Modi says the perception that the 2002 riots were the biggest riots ever in Gujarat was an attempt to push misinformation

title: Kedarnath MLA demands ban on ‘non-Hindus’ from Char Dham Yatra region
content: Sources say local businessmen had complained about sales of non-vegetarian food and liquor on the route of the Kedarnath temple

title: ‘ரூ’ made into big news by those who dislike Tamil: Stalin
content: In a video clip of the Ungalil Oruvan Q&A posted on his social media handle, he says that the alphabet was incorporated to show how assertive they are in their language policy

title: Mumbai Economic Offences Wing arrests two more accused persons in New India Co-operative Bank fraud case
content: ‘It is alleged that Arunachalam Ullahanathan Maruthuvar received approximately ₹30 crore from the misappropriated funds of NICB from the main accused Hitesh Mehta,’ officials said

title: Transport unions urge Govt. to revise prices of tracking devices, panic buttons
content: The unions argue that the steep costs, coupled with a lack of awareness, have made it challenging for many vehicle owners to comply with the mandate

title: Protests prohibited in Osmania University, says varsity circular
content: It advised that registered students with grievances first approach the officials concerned at the institution level and then represent to the Registrar and other authorities with prior permission

title: Devotees of Rettamalai Temple suffer in the absence of a good road
content: The temple attracts more than 2,000 devotees, most whom visit the temple to offer special puja, and travel by cars, vans, and two-wheelers.

title: Opposition will continue to press for debate on EPIC and delimitation in Parliament
content: The Parliament in the upcoming week is scheduled to discuss the functioning of the Home Ministry in the Rajya Sabha and Agriculture Ministry in the Lok Sabha

title: U.P. village on the boil as Ambedkar’s name on village entrance gate, his statue vandalised
content: Lok Sabha MP Chandra Shekhar Aazad demands immediate restoration of Dr. Ambedkar’s statue, which was vandalised a few days before, and the name on the gate.

title: Forest department fails to tranquillize injured tiger in Vandiperiyar
content: They were unable to trace the animal, which was under the surveillance of the Forest department till Saturday evening. The animal is suspected of moving to a nearby area

title: Model primary schools should not undermine existing institutions, caution UTF leaders
content: Calling for due diligence while introducing reforms, they say that upper primary schools, with a strength of above 60, should either be upgraded into high schools or be allowed to continue in their present form; inordinate delay in payment of dues to employees and teachers a cause for concern, they say

title: Yediyurappa is not just a leader of any one community, says Vijayendra
content: He has worked for the development of the party and the State all his life, according to State BJP president

title: Delimitation is conspiracy to reduce political power of south India, says Mallikarjun Kharge
content: ‘BJP-led government at Centre seems to have decided to reduce LS seats from south, and increase the total number of seats for north India by around 30%’

title: Officials told to cancel wills or property transfers in cases of elderly parents being abandoned in hospitals
content: Over 150 senior citizens were deserted in Belagavi Institute of Medical Sciences, and over 100 similar cases were reported from other medical institutions in the State

title: Chittoor police launch six Shakthi teams
content: Seven police personnel, including two women, to be attached to each team led by an SI or an ASI rank officer, says Chittoor SP

title: Excise and cyber police take down 61 Instagram accounts that promote drug use
content: Police cyber operations chief Ankit Ashokan confirms that a legal notice was issued to Instagram, leading to the removal of the accounts

title: 25 diarrhoea cases reported among tobacco workers in East Godavari district
content: At least 19 patients have been discharged from Gopalapuram PHC, while six others are undergoing treatment on Sunday, says district Medical and Health Officer in an official release

title: Man brutally murdered in Shahapur, another killed in retaliation
content: The murdered history sheeter has been identified as Mapanna Bheemappa Badiger, a native of Madriki village in Shahapur

title: A Dalit community’s generational wait to see god — and the backlash for breaking barriers
content: In West Bengal’s Gidhagram village in Purba Bardhaman district, hundreds of Dalits down the years had been prevented from praying at a local Shiva temple. On March 12, under the watchful eye of the district administration and the police, five people of the community climbed the 16 steps to the sanctum sanctorum. Shrabana Chatterjee finds that while the castes mingled socially before, the Dalit entry into the temple has now heightened discrimination

title: IPL excitement in the air as Team DC is set to arrive in Visakhapatnam on March 17
content: Delhi Capitals will play its first match against Lucknow Supergiants on March 24 and its second match on March 30 against Sunrisers Hyderabad

title: Pawan Kalyan emerging as a national leader, says JSP leader
content: The JSP president’s ‘nation first, everything next’ policy will strengthen unity among the people of all the States irrespective of different ideologies, languages and other differences, says Vishwaksen

title: New Immigration Bill proposes seven-year jail term for using forged passport
content: The Bill empowers the Union government to regulate the entry, exit, and movement of foreigners within India

title: CIAL board approves second phase of rehabilitation package
content: The second phase of the package will apply to those who did not receive sufficient support in the first phase

title: State government intervenes to expedite paddy procurement in Alappuzha
content: A high level meeting instructs rapid response teams under the Agriculture department to intervene effectively in procurement-related issues and also to open a control room to address concerns regarding this

title: T.N.’s mangrove cover grows to 9,039 ha in 2024, has significant carbon stock: report
content: The increase can be attributed to both new mangrove plantations and the preservation of existing ones across several districts, says the report by Anna University’s Centre for Climate Change and Disaster Management

title: Immunising the elderly is crucial in disease prevention, say experts
content: Doctors stressed the need for proactive administration of vaccines to protect older adults from preventable diseases at the ‘Prevention of Illness: Immunising the Elderly’ webinar organised by Naruvi Hospitals, Vellore in collaboration with The Hindu

title: Padaharam bridge set to be open in April
content: While the construction of the bridge is completed, work on the approach roads and painting is still in progress

title: Hathras: College professor suspended for sexually exploiting girls
content: "Please save the girl students... Due to public shame, no girl student will say anything. Therefore, please take strict action against this monster and provide justice to many girls like me," she added

title: NCB and DRI lose two major drug seizure cases in Kerala
content: Trial courts in Kochi dump cases related to alleged seizure of 217.525 kg of heroin to the tune of ₹1,526 crore from two vessels and another 2,525.675 kg of methamphetamine hydrochloride from an Iranian from a vessel

title: Kerala sees a surge in social media-based drug supply chains
content: Digital transactions using cryptocurrency likely to displace in-person transactions between narcotic suppliers, peddlers and users, according to law enforcement and excise officers. A top-level meeting resolves to track digital couriers and infiltrate social media groups that promote the subculture of drugs and music to prevent the inflow of hallucinogens

title: ‘Healthy Kids’ textbooks to be introduced from the new academic year: Minister V. Abdurahiman
content: “One Playground in One Panchayat” initiative meant to foster sportsmanship and keep youth away from substance abuse

title: RPF Director-General reviews working of training centre in Tiruchi
content: The RPF chief commends the unwavering dedication and commitment of the personnel in ensuring safety and security of railway passengers and property across the nation

title: We’re not under pressure in case involving illegal storage of food items, say Hubballi-Dharwad Police
content: Police Commissioner N. Shashikumar has said that the police have already arrested 32 people in the case, while two main accused are still at large

title: Kollam Pooram: permission for fireworks display denied
content: Decision to deny permission was issued considering the impracticality of safely conducting fireworks in the Asramam ground as well as the inability to establish  a magazine as per Petroleum and Explosives Safety Organisation regulations for storing explosives in the location

title: Launderers to get a dedicated spot at Panchakarai
content: A sum of ₹57 lakh has been sanctioned for constructing the facility at a vacant space behind the STEM park in Srirangam and it is expected to be completed within four months after work begins

title: Men's Bracketology: Indiana, Xavier, Boise State must play the waiting game
content: There are two final spots available, but the fates of Indiana, Xavier and Boise State rest in the hands of the American and A-10 title games. Watch the men's bracket reveal starting at 6 p.m. ET on ESPN.

title: Duke proves 'toughness' minus Flagg to win ACC
content: No. 1 Duke showed off its depth with Cooper Flagg sidelined and defeated 13th-ranked Louisville 73-62 to clinch its second ACC tournament title in three seasons under Jon Scheyer.

title: Ravens adding QB Rush as Lamar's new backup
content: The Ravens reached agreement with former Cowboys quarterback Cooper Rush on Sunday, his agency, Equity Sports, announced.

title: Source: Pulisic in talks over new AC Milan deal
content: United States national team star Christian Pulisic is in negotiations with AC Milan over a new contract, a source has told ESPN.

title: St. John's wins first Big East tourney since 2000
content: The No. 1 seed coming into the tournament played like it all week at Madison Square Garden, as coach Rick Pitino and his St. John's Red Storm secured their first Big East title since 2000, and will head into Selection Sunday on a nine-game winning streak.

title: Vikings acquiring RB Mason in trade with 49ers
content: The Vikings added a young veteran running back to pair with starter Aaron Jones, landing Jordan Mason in a trade with the 49ers.

title: Hanshin Tigers sweep Cubs, Dodgers in shutouts
content: The Hanshin Tigers capped a two-game sweep over MLB clubs with a 3-0 win over the Dodgers, following a matching victory over the Cubs the day before.

title: Betts struggling with illness, could miss opener
content: Dodgers shortstop Mookie Betts is still struggling to recover from an illness, with manager Dave Roberts pessimistic that the eight-time All-Star will be ready for Opening Day in Japan.

title: Bickerstaff 'disgusted' by techs in Pistons' loss
content: Detroit's J.B. Bickerstaff blasted the officials after the Pistons were called for five technical fouls in the third quarter of a 113-107 loss to the Oklahoma City Thunder Saturday, telling reporters he was "disgusted by the way that game was officiated."

title: All eyes on top eight teams, top 16 seeds ahead of Selection Sunday and women’s NCAA bracket
content: Where the Nos. 1 and 2 seeds play in the regionals is as big of a question this Selection Sunday as which bubble teams will be in the field.

title: Inside the Western wild-card race
content: The Wild appear locked in to the first spot, but who gets the second? Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings, more.

title: Making sense of QB moves in NFL free agency: We ranked the 10 best fits and answered big questions
content: Sam Darnold to Seattle. Geno Smith to Las Vegas. Aaron Rodgers to ...? Our experts sort through quarterback signings, trades and extensions.

title: 'That makes our one and two even better': Can the Kyle Kuzma trade maximize Giannis, Dame and the Bucks?
content: Milwaukee parted ways with a franchise cornerstone to acquire Kyle Kuzma, a below-the-radar trade that the Bucks believe can rekindle vibes of their 2021 title run.

title: Real Madrid won't play without 72 hours' rest
content: Real Madrid's official TV channel have confirmed the team will refuse to play in future if their players aren't given a minimum 72 hours' rest between matches.

title: Pulisic equals career-best goal tally in Milan win
content: Christian Pulisic equaled his career-best goal tally in a single season with his 15th goal of the campaign in AC Milan's 2-1 win over Como on Saturday.

title: USMNT's Haji Wright nets 1st hat trick in England
content: A 26-year-old from Los Angeles, Wright scored in the 21st minute, then converted a penalty kick in the 29th after he was fouled by Chris Mepham. Wright scored in the 73rd for his 10th goal in 19 league matches this season.

title: Pep: Man City face '9 finals' to qualify for UCL
content: While Pep Guardiola and Manchester City are in the unlikeliest of positions having to battle desperately for a Champions League berth next season, the manager did not mince his words in describing the enormity of the challenge.

title: Dele Alli sent off 9 minutes into Como debut
content: Dele Alli's first professional football match in 748 days lasted just nine minutes as he was shown a straight red card for a foul on Ruben Loftus-Cheek.

title: Wrexham beat promotion rivals Wycombe; go 2nd
content: Wrexham took a huge step towards securing automatic promotion to the Championship with an important 1-0 against Wycombe Wanderers at Adams Park on Saturday.

title: Late Hollerbach goal stuns Bayern in Bundesliga
content: A moment of uncertainty from goalkeeper Jonas Urbig allowed Benedict Hollerbach to score a late goal as Union Berlin secured a 1-1 home draw with Bayern Munich.

title: Mascherano defends handling of Messi fitness
content: Inter Miami head coach Javier Mascherano revealed the team controlled Lionel Messi's fatigue well to avoid any injury.

title: Ronald Acuna Jr. says he'll be more careful this season -- but no one believes him
content: From 40/70 to 40/30? The Braves' 2023 NL MVP is rehabbing with a plan to be stronger -- and healthier.

title: Champions League qualification is the only positive Man City have left -- and they might miss it
content: Man City's awful season could end with one positive: qualification for next season's Champions League. But they are playing so poorly, they might not even get there.

title: One down, three to go: Chelsea on course for quadruple after League Cup win
content: Chelsea's bid to win four trophies was kick-started with a 2-1 win over Man City in the League Cup final.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Liverpool's Luis Díaz
content: Could Liverpool forward Luis Díaz swap Anfield for Camp Nou this summer? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Geovany Quenda can be Chelsea's answer to Saka
content: Chelsea look set to land the Sporting CP teen in 2026 and Quenda's style has been compared to an Arsenal star.

title: Niemann, Johnson share lead at LIV Singapore
content: Joaquín Niemann shot a 64 to move up the leaderboard and tie Dustin Johnson for the second-round lead at LIV Golf Singapore.

title: LeBron James watches on as Bryce, Sierra Canyon win state title Friday night
content: The Arizona Wildcats commit finished with 3 points, 5 rebounds and 2 assists as Sierra Canyon (Chatsworth, California) defeated Lincoln (Stockton, California) 58-53 on Friday night.

title: '9/11, Parliament Attack...': PM On Events Leading Up To 2002 Gujarat Riots
content: The 2002 Sabarmati Express attack in Gujarat's Godhra was a "tragedy of unimaginable magnitude" and the riots that followed this "was tragic for everyone," Prime Minister Narendra Modi said.

title: "She Herself Used Tamil Letter": MK Stalin On N Sitharaman's "Rupee" Attack
content: Defending his government's move to replace the rupee symbol with the Tamil letter 'Ru' in the state Budget logo, Chief Minister MK Stalin said even Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman had used the Tamil letter instead of the rupee symbol.

title: Why Lex Fridman Fasted For 45 Hours Before Podcast With PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi had a wide-ranging interaction with US podcaster Lex Fridman. Mr Fridman said that he fasted for 45 hours before the podcast "in honour of this conversation".

title: SpaceX Crew Dragon Docks With Space Station To Reach Sunita Williams
content: A pair of astronauts stranded for more than nine months on the International Space Station were a step closer to returning home after a replacement crew docked with the orbital outpost.

title: Live Updates: NASA's Crew-10 Joins Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore
content: Crew-10 ISS Space Docking Live Updates: NASA and SpaceX launched a crewed mission to the International Space Station to bring home astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore.

title: What Do You Like About Trump As A Friend, Leader? PM Was Asked. His Reply
content: The man has courage. Makes his own decisions. His America First approach. These are some of the qualities that Prime Minister Narendra Modi said impressed him about US President Donald Trump.

title: Patels Were Out For Treat. Vadodara Crash Left Woman Dead, Husband Critical
content: It was the evening before Holi. Hemali Patel, 35, and Purav Patel, 40, were out with their daughter after Holika Dahan to buy colours and grab something to eat. They were on a scooter, riding through Vadodara's streets and planning the Holi bash

title: PM Modi's 1+1 Theory: "One Is Modi, Other Is Divine"
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, sharing his view of life with podcast host Lex Fridman, has said difficulties are only a test of endurance.

title: IML Final: Rayudu, Yuvraj Keep India Masters In Command vs WI Masters In Chase
content: IML 2025 Final LIVE Updates, India Masters vs West Indies Masters LIVE Score: Ambati Rayudu is solid after scoring his half-century while Yuvraj Singh is also looking good

title: All About Joshua Riibe, Man Last Seen With Missing Indian-American Student
content: Sudiksha Konanki, a 20-year-old Indian-American student, vanished while on a spring break trip to Punta Cana, Dominican Republic.

title: US Green Card Holder Stripped Naked, Interrogated by US Officials: Report
content: Fabian Schmidt, who has lived in the US since his teenage years and currently resides in New Hampshire, was returning from a trip to Luxembourg.

title: PM Modi Was Asked If He Fears Death. What He Said
content: Death is inevitable and what truly matters is how life is lived, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said in a podcast with Lex Fridman released on Sunday.

title: Here's How Much NASA Could Pay Sunita Williams For 9-Month Space Stay
content: Sunita Williams is classified under the GS-15 pay grade, which is the highest level for federal employees under the General Schedule (GS) system

title: "Could've Restricted Pak To...": NZ Captain Adds Insult To Injury After Win
content: New Zealand captain Michael Bracewell said that his team could've restricted Pakistan to an even lower score after bowling them out for 91 in the 1st T20I.

title: Playing Holi 'Crime': Shami's Daughter Becomes Cleric's Fresh Target
content: In Saturday's video message, he suggested that those, including Shami, who could not keep fast should do it after Ramzan.

title: 59 Trips To Bengaluru, Mumbai: 2 Foreigners Arrested With Rs 75 Crore Drugs
content: Two Nigerian women have been arrested with over 37 kg of drugs valued at Rs 75 crore at the Bengaluru airport, the biggest-ever drug haul in Karnataka, the police said on Sunday.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: KKR suffer big blow! Umran Malik ruled out of IPL 2025
content: Kolkata Knight Riders have faced a significant blow before IPL 2025 as their top pacer Umran Malik has been ruled out due to an injury. They have signed left-arm pacer Chetan Sakariya, who was unsold in the auction, for Rs 75 lakh as his replacement. Known for his raw pace, Umran, who represented Sunrisers Hyderabad from 2021 to 2024, was bought by Kolkata Knight Riders for Rs 75 lakh at the IPL 2025 Auction.

title: US judge halts Trump deportation under Alien Enemies Act, turning around planes
content: A federal judge blocked President Trump's attempt to deport Venezuelan immigrants using a 1798 law, citing risks of persecution. The judge’s order to return airborne flights led to a heated response from the Trump administration, accusing the judiciary of endangering public safety by supporting gang members.

title: Amazon, Flipkart warehouses raided: Toys, Kitchen appliances ... seized
content: India's Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) has conducted raids on Amazon and Flipkart warehouses to uncover non-certified products, including toys, kitchen appliances, and electrical equipment. These efforts are part of a broader initiative to curb the distribution of substandard goods on e-commerce platforms and ensure consumer safety.

title: US threatens 'unrelenting' strikes on Houthis until they are 'done shooting at ships'
content: The United States has launched a series of airstrikes against Houthi rebels in Yemen following attacks on American and allied shipping. Defense secretary Pete Hegseth emphasised that the strikes will continue until the Houthis cease shooting at ships and assets. President Trump and other officials have warned Iran, backing the Houthis, to halt their support.

title: Infosys cofounder Narayana Murthy: Somehow it has become a fashion in India to ...
content: NR Narayana Murthy, co-founder of Infosys, addressed the hype around AI in India, stating that many systems are just traditional programming. He emphasized that genuine AI involves machine learning and deep learning, which can greatly enhance human-like capabilities.

title: Corbin Bosch faces legal action from PCB for breach of PSL contract
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has issued a legal notice to South African cricketer Corbin Bosch for not honoring his commitment to the Pakistan Super League (PSL). Bosch was selected by Peshawar Zalmi but withdrew to join the Mumbai Indians in the IPL. This incident has raised concerns about player loyalty and contract enforcement between PSL and IPL commitments.

title: 'Last time you were fasting': When Obama told PM Modi to 'eat twice as much’
content: PM Narendra Modi recounted his fasting practice during a visit to the White House. His routine of fasting, which he has followed for over 50 years, left an impression on former President Obama. Modi explained the scientific and spiritual discipline behind fasting.

content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: DeepSeek gets 'National Treasure in China' status
content: DeepSeek, a prominent Chinese AI startup, has implemented travel restrictions on key employees by seizing their passports. This move aims to prevent leaks of sensitive data, potentially including trade or state secrets, as global concerns regarding AI-based intellectual property escalate.

title: 'Results speak for themselves': PM Modi hails Team India's record vs Pakistan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted India's strong cricket record against Pakistan in international matches during the Lex Fridman podcast. He praised sports for uniting people and influencing global harmony. Modi refrained from naming the best team, citing game results as indicative. He also celebrated Diego Maradona and Lionel Messi as football icons significant to different generations.

title: Sunita Williams homecoming mission: Crew reaches ISS - What happens next?
content: A SpaceX Dragon spacecraft successfully docked with the ISS, allowing for the anticipated rescue of NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore after an unexpected nine-month stay. With Crew-10's arrival, efforts to transition responsibilities to the new crew are underway, as NASA prepares for the astronauts' return to Earth.

title: Congress slams PM Modi’s remarks on 2002 Gujarat riots in Lex Fridman’s podcast
content: Congress leaders heavily criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his remarks on the 2002 Gujarat riots during an interview with Lex Fridman. They accused him of deflecting responsibility and attempting to justify the violence. Modi defended his position, citing prior terrorist attacks and a peaceful period in Gujarat post-2002.

title: 'Rohit Sharma & Virat Kohli can decide when they want to stop'
content: New Zealand spinner Ajaz Patel has expressed support for Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli asserting their right to decide their ODI futures. He praised their exceptional careers and emphasized their impact on the game. Patel acknowledged India's recent success in the Champions Trophy and highlighted the significance of the IPL for New Zealand players.

title: ‘We chose peace, they chose proxy war’: PM Modi blasts Pak for 'betrayal'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in a podcast with Lex Fridman, discussed India's strained relationship with Pakistan, attributing it to Pakistan's state-sponsored terrorism and unfulfilled peace efforts. He also recalled past diplomatic gestures, including inviting Nawaz Sharif for his swearing-in and his surprise visit to Lahore, which were met with hostility.

title: ‘People told time by his footsteps’: PM Modi opens up about his father
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared insights about his early life, highlighting the discipline of his father, his own resourcefulness, and the challenges of growing up in poverty. Despite financial hardships, his family maintained a positive outlook, focusing on hard work and perseverance without complaints.

title: 'Remember...': Indian-origin Silicon Valley leader supports action against Ranjani Srinivasan
content: Columbia University PhD student Ranjani Srinivasan fled to Canada after her student visa was revoked for alleged support of Hamas. Using the CBP Home app, she self-deported after she escaped arrest by ICE agents twice. Rishi Kumar, an executive board member of the California Democratic Party, who also ran in an election, supported the visa revocation and said this should be a warning for all international students.

title: Unsold Shardul Thakur to play for Lucknow Super Giants in IPL 2025?
content: Shardul Thakur, unsold at the IPL auction last November, may join Lucknow Super Giants as an injury replacement for IPL 2025. He was seen training with the team and celebrating Holi, sparking speculation. Thakur has previously played for multiple IPL teams and performed well in recent domestic tournaments. Official confirmation from LSG is awaited.

title: Photos of Trump watching Yemen strike in golf attire viral
content: At least 13 civilians were killed, and nine injured, in strikes on Yemen’s capital city of Sanaa. At least 11 others, including four children and one woman, were killed, and 14 injured, in a strike on the northern province of Saada. The Houthis’ political bureau described the attacks as a war crime and said in a statement, “Our Yemeni armed forces are fully prepared to respond to escalation with escalation.”

title: BLA claims 90 Pakistani soldiers killed in attack on army convoy in Balochistan
content: In Balochistan, a Pakistani military convoy was attacked by the Baloch Liberation Army, resulting in 90 army personnel deaths. The convoy comprised eight buses, with one completely destroyed. However, a Pakistani police officer confirmed five paramilitary deaths. Earlier this week, a similar attack by the BLA led the military to free hostages from a train siege in Balochistan.

title: Month before Vadodara crash, accused was let off with just an apology
content: A law student, Rakshit Chaurasia, involved in a fatal accident in Karelibaug, had a previous brush with the law in February. He and other youths created a commotion but were pardoned after apologizing to the lawyer they threatened. Both incidents underline a pattern of misconduct.

title: 'Plan will be to replicate the past success ...': Karun Nair eyes IPL glory
content: Karun Nair is set to play for Delhi Capitals in the upcoming IPL season after a stellar domestic performance. Nair is eager to maintain his form and contribute to the team's first IPL title. He praised Axar Patel's captaincy and looks forward to playing with KL Rahul. Nair is ready to adapt quickly and stay in rhythm.

title: PM Modi's podcast with Lex Fridman out: Talks about early life, journey in Himalayas & more
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi engaged in a captivating podcast with MIT scientist Lex Fridman. They discussed Modi's journey from childhood to public life, touching upon global affairs and governance. Fridman had previously described Modi as one of the most fascinating people he has studied.

title: 'You don't have to compete with Samson': Ex-cricketer on Pant's return to T20I side
content: Former cricketer Aakash Chopra sees IPL 2025 as crucial for Rishabh Pant's return to India's T20I squad, playing for Lucknow Super Giants. Pant must perform strongly to shake up the competition, especially against first-choice Sanju Samson. Chopra suggests Pant should focus on strategic batting positions, with significant team changes expected before the T20 World Cup.

title: Maharashtra among hottest places in India as heat streak continues
content: Parts of Maharashtra, particularly Vidarbha, have been experiencing extreme heat with temperatures soaring above 40°C. Chandrapur hit 42°C, making it one of the hottest spots in India. High temperatures coupled with low humidity have been causing severe discomfort.

title: Ex-driver kills caretaker at former footballer PK Banerjee’s home
content: In Kolkata, PK Banerjee's caretaker, Gopinath Muhuri, was killed by the late footballer's former driver, Barun Ghosh, during a heated argument over missing money. The altercation escalated during a drinking session, resulting in Gopinath being fatally stabbed. Barun was arrested after the incident, which occurred at Banerjee's Salt Lake residence.

title: Tantrik hangs 6-month-old over fire in MP's Shivpuri, eyes damaged
content: A six-month-old child suffered severe burns on the face and eyes due to being hung upside down over a fire by a self-proclaimed sorcerer in Madhya Pradesh. The baby is currently receiving critical care treatment. An investigation is ongoing, and the accused is currently at large.

title: Triple murder near Bengaluru: Drunken brawl over woman turns deadly
content: Three construction laborers died in Bengaluru during a drunken brawl while celebrating Holi. The altercation, involving a woman, occurred on the third floor of an under-construction building in Sarjapura. Two to three suspects escaped, and police have formed teams to apprehend them. Superintendent CK Baba assured imminent arrests as the investigation progresses.

title: Greenland: Hundreds protest against Trump's takeover plans
content: Hundreds of Greenlanders protested against US President Donald Trump's plan to take control of their island. Demonstrators in Nuuk waved flags and held signs emphasizing 'Respect Greenland's sovereignty.' Greenlandic leaders, including Jens-Frederik Nielsen and outgoing Prime Minister Mute B. Egede, strongly rejected Trump's idea, calling it 'unacceptable.' Greenland's parliament also issued a joint statement opposing the annexation.

title: Mughal queen Mumtaz inspired world’s second best-selling perfume
content: A persume inspired by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan's love for Mumtaz Mahal, debuted in 1921. Housed in a stunning Baccarat bottle, this iconic fragrance has become a timeless symbol of sophistication, selling 108 bottles per hour globally.

title: 'Expired insurance': Tej Pratap Yadav fined for not wearing helmet
content: RJD MLA Tej Pratap Yadav was fined Rs. 4,000 for riding a scooter without a helmet during Holi celebrations in Patna. Additionally, his security constable was relieved of duty after being seen dancing in uniform, following Yadav's controversial instruction to perform a 'thumka' under threat of suspension.

title: TMCP neta stabbed to death in Titagarh during Holi brawl
content: A 24-year-old Trinamool Congress Chatra Parishad functionary, Akash Choudhury, was fatally stabbed during Holi celebrations in Titagarh. Akash was attacked after protesting a group of intoxicated individuals causing a disturbance. Police arrested two suspects, including Pawan Rajbhar, identified as the main perpetrator. Two other suspects remain at large. Locals demand swift justice.

title: Norris' narrow Australian GP win over Verstappen belies McLaren dominance
content: Lando Norris wins the first race of the season in Melbourne . the 0.8-second winning margin over Max Verstappen belied the performance of his McLaren MCL39 . norris' old friend and persistent foe was tucked right under his rear wing .

title: Women's Bracketology: UCSD seals first bid, Harvard's win keeps Ivy intrigue alive
content: NCAA tournament bids now total 31 as we count down to selection Sunday on March 16 . it will be the Crimson's first trip to the tournament since 2007, and they likely won't be the only Ivy team in the field . four losses in the past six games could keep Virginia Tech out .

title: What do the first two rounds of a perfect draft look like?
content: fantasy baseball managers all over the world are getting ready for those ever-crucial drafts . they say practice makes perfect -- and you can certainly practice your drafting skills in our Mock Draft Lobby . Tristan H. Cockcroft and Eric Karabell weighed in on each of their ideal picks from each of the 10 draft positions in an ESPN standard league .

title: Dissecting the Eastern wild-card race
content: each of the teams in the Eastern Conference playoff mix has 15 to 17 games remaining in the regular season . a current three-game winning streak certainly helps the New Jersey Devils . the Columbus Blue Jackets technically are in the second wild-card spot thanks to getting to 70 points in fewer games played (65) than the New York Rangers (66).

title: 'Hold that rock up, baby': DK Metcalf reveals engagement to Normani
content: the two-time pro bowler revealed he's engaged to R&B star Normani . the couple began dating in 2022 after being introduced by singer Ciara . he joined fifth Harmony, a girl group formed from solo contestants .
